title: Tripadvisor to cut 20% of staff amid internal restructuring
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Tripadvisor is cutting 20% of its workforce as it merges operations with Viator to streamline and focus on travel experiences.
The restructuring includes an $85 million cost-savings program aimed at transforming Tripadvisor into an experience-led, AI-enabled company.
The reorganization affects approximately 600 employees globally, with a focus on simplifying and integrating services into AI platforms like ChatGPT.

title: An abandoned tent has spurred a hiking mystery in New Hampshire
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Abandoned tent found in New Hampshire's White Mountains; no missing hikers reported, according to Fish and Game officials.
Search team found car keys and Apple AirTag at the campsite; no matching vehicle found in nearby parking areas.
Social media posts about the tent have drawn speculation and many comments, but no confirmed information on the owner.

title: Local obituary: Susan Hurley, 62, former Patriots cheerleader who founded CharityTeams
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Susan Hurley, 62, former Patriots cheerleader and CharityTeams founder, passed away from ovarian cancer on November 1, 2025.
Hurley founded CharityTeams, helping nonprofits raise $42 million through races; notably involved with Boston Marathon charity events.
A Celebration of Life for Susan Hurley will be held on November 8 at Waters Church in Norwood, Massachusetts.

title: Market Basket launches its own beer — here’s where to buy it
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Market Basket launches 'More For Your Dollar' lager in collaboration with Zero Gravity Beer from Vermont.
The 12-pack lager is priced at $12.99, available at MB Spirits and MB Beer & Wine in Massachusetts, Maine, and New Hampshire.
The launch follows a leadership change at Market Basket, with the removal of CEO Arthur T. Demoulas.

title: As SJC mulls involvement in public defender work stoppage, here’s where things stand
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Massachusetts public defenders resumed work stoppage despite a 30% pay increase, leaving over 900 defendants without representation.
The Supreme Judicial Court is considering involvement in raising pay for court-appointed attorneys, sparking separation of powers concerns.
Public defenders, essential for 80% of indigent cases, seek better compensation as current rates lag behind neighboring states.

title: Reese Witherspoon visits Boston bookstore
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Reese Witherspoon visited Beacon Hill Books and Cafe in Boston, signing copies of her novel 'Gone Before Goodbye.'
The actress co-authored the New York Times bestseller with Harlan Coben and dined privately at the bookstore.
Witherspoon spoke at Harvard Business School, reflecting on her role in 'Legally Blonde' and discussing her Book Club.

title: GOP lawmakers pushing Healey for info on aide arrested in cocaine bust
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: LaMar Cook, a former aide to Gov. Maura Healey, was arrested for trafficking cocaine to a state office building.
Republican lawmakers are questioning Gov. Healey's vetting process following Cook's arrest, highlighting previous criminal charges against him.
GOP gubernatorial candidates demand an independent investigation, claiming Cook's case highlights failed leadership within Healey's administration.

title: 2 teens killed in New Bedford crash identified
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Two teens, Gabriel Bertolino Siqueira, 17, and Anne Urbanski Santos De Carvalho, 15, died in a car crash in New Bedford.
The crash occurred on Route 140 South around 2 a.m.; both teens were ejected from the vehicle.
An 18-year-old driver survived with non-life-threatening injuries; the crash investigation is ongoing.

title: BPD releases multiple photos of baseball-capped commercial burglary suspect
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston police are asking for the public's help to identify a man involved in several commercial burglaries.
The suspect used a pry tool to break into downtown businesses overnight, starting on August 21.
The man stole credit cards, cash, and electronics, and photos have been released to aid identification.

title: Report: Mike Vrabel’s former team was ‘unwilling’ to trade with Patriots
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Tennessee Titans reportedly refused to trade with the New England Patriots due to past tensions with coach Mike Vrabel.
Owner Amy Adams Strunk allegedly avoided deals with the Patriots because of Vrabel's departure from Tennessee after the 2023 season.
The Patriots, under coach Mike Vrabel, expressed interest in trades but ultimately made no major moves by the NFL trade deadline.
